description: As the second round of elections on Sunday, July 7, is set to usher in an unprecedented situation for the Fifth Republic, an atypical model of crisis resolution, used several times by our Italian neighbors, could be a source of inspiration.
title: Could Macron set up a technical government after the elections? A few lessons from the Italian experience

description: The city's rising cost of housing, up 68% in the past decade according to local authorities, is one of the main issues for the movement, along with the effects of tourism on local commerce and working conditions.
title: Barcelona residents protest against mass tourism

description: The Dutch struck two second-half goals in seven minutes to come from behind to beat Turkey 2-1 on Saturday and set up a Euro 2024 semi-final clash with England.
title: Euro 2024: Netherlands into semifinal against England after beating Turkey

description: England's quest for a first major tournament win in 58 years remained alive after another late fightback before beating Switzerland 5-3 on penalties to book their place in the semi-finals on Saturday. The English team goes on to play the Netherlands in Dortmund on Wednesday for a spot in the final.
title: Euro 2024: England beats Switzerland in a penalty shootout to reach semifinals

description: At a time when the far-right Rassemblement National party could be victorious in France's parliamentary elections, Jair Bolsonaro's four years in power in Brazil have shown that 'testing' the far right is never trivial.
title: 'The Bolsonaro experience in Brazil has shown that the victory of the far right is never trivial'

description: Since his return to power in October 2023, nationalist Prime Minister Robert Fico has escalated efforts to dismiss employees deemed a problem within public media, the police and the judiciary. The assassination attempt against him in May has only bolstered his determination to bring these institutions into line.
title: Slovakia undertakes purging of power within institutions

description: Speaking at the first Alliance of Sahel States summit, gathering the juntas that seized power in Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso, General Abdourahamane Tiani cemented the break with the West African regional bloc.
title: Niger's military leader states Niger, Mali, Burkina 'irrevocably turned backs' on ECOWAS

description: Since July 1, Swedish parents can each give 45 days of parental leave to a third party, who will be compensated for looking after the child, a system designed to assist families' organization, though it has drawn criticism.
title: Sweden allows grandparents to take parental leave

description: With the arrival of the first Western fighter jets sent by Ukraine's allies having been announced for July, Russia has stepped up its strikes on Ukrainian air bases.
title: Russia steps up pressure to block the transfer of F-16s to Ukraine

description: The former government's controversial plan to deport asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda, which had sparked legal challenges, is the first measure discontinued by newly-elected UK prime minister Keir Starmer.
title: UK's new PM Starmer scraps controversial Rwanda deportation plan

description: The French soccer team, which once again proved lackluster offensively, qualified for the Euro semi-finals after a perfectly controlled penalty shootout (0-0, 5 penalties to 3).
title: France-Portugal: Les Bleus overcome the trauma of penalty shootouts

description: Several important ministers hail from very modest families and were schooled in the public education system, breaking with prior Conservative governments, whose members were mostly educated in private schools.
title: UK PM Keir Starmer's new government is characterized by social diversity

description: The far right's success has not only reshaped the French political landscape but also penetrated the intimacy of the home. Five families explain this swing, motivated by fear, disillusionment, exasperation and prejudice, which forces everyone to take a stand.
title: The RN vote creeps into families: 'I was really ashamed, and he felt it'

description: Speaking on ABC, the US president shut down calls to withdraw from the race, considering himself as the 'most qualified' to beat Donald Trump. Yet since his failed debate, Democratic voices are increasingly urging him to step aside.
title: Joe Biden maintains his candidacy but fails to reassure Democrats

description: In an interview, the Russian theatre director, who opened the Festival d'Aix-en-Provence on July 3, explains how he conceived his diptych of Gluck operas around Iphigenia.
title: Dmitri Tcherniakov: 'There's nothing exceptional about the Atreides family, they're people of today'

description: A vote count offered by authorities put Pezeshkian as the winner with 16.3 million votes to Saeed Jalili’s 13.5 million in Friday’s election.
title: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian wins Iran's presidential runoff election

description: Amid the latest deadly strikes, a team of Israeli negotiators is set to resume talks next week on a ceasefire and hostage exchange deal with Hamas, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said Friday, signaling progress toward a deal to end the war in Gaza after negotiations appeared stuck for weeks.
title: Israeli strikes kill 6 in Gaza, including kids and UN worker, as stalled truce talks reemerge

description: Marine Le Pen has been riding a wave of positive momentum for the past two years, which could give her far-right party a majority in the Assemblée Nationale just two years after a difficult presidential election.
title: How the Rassemblement National found itself on the doorstep of power

description: Over 1,200 hectares of Palestinian land have been declared 'state land' by Benjamin Netanyahu's government. This decision, taken in the context of the war in Gaza, is part of a policy of annexing territory of the West Bank.
title: Israel grabs largest tract of West Bank land in three decades

description: The president insisted to ABC's George Stephanopoulos that he is the 'most qualified' to lead Democrats against presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.
title: Biden rejects independent medical evaluation in ABC interview as he fights to stay in race
